rComments: Suazo a cool guy. Took him back in '14 for writing 2. Not a lot of work, interesting topics. An essay here and there, but what writing class doesn't have essays? Pretty sure he gave B's all across, don't really care.

It was a pretty easy class to take. Super boring though. Sometimes I felt bad, no one would ever say anything and he would just stand there hoping for someone to respond for once. I got a B though so it's good.

He was a cool guy. And the class isn't too difficult, just 3 essays and he gives you feedback on the drafts to tell you what you need to fix. Although class was kinda boring. I ended up with a B, i think he wants us to engage in his discussions that's why.
I loved the way he dressed! So stylish! I did all of the work in class but I still got a B :/.I improved my writting and class wasn't that bad. I liked him.

This was the Autobiography class. He was very engaging in class and made it very clear what was expected. It's helpful to talk to him or email him about the assignments, because all you have to do is stay on track to do well/pass. He is very nice and kind but still provides useful feedback. My writing improved by this class.

I'm in his W2 autobiographies class right now and the first two papers are easy because you simply write about yourself. The other 3 papers however are about testing the limits of autobiographies, not really interesting. The class is so boring but thankfully no section. He hands out for the most part boring readings. UNORGANIZED. TOO many e-mails.
